item.title: skate. Early Access Season 1 begins October 7
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Xbox One
  • Xbox Series

New events, challenges, music, and more.

Free-to-play physics-based skateboarding game skate. Early Access Season 1 will begin on October 7, with new events, challenges, music, a lighting update, and skate.Pass, publisher Electronic Arts and developer Full Circle announced.

Here are the details:

  • New Events
    • Skate-o-Ween (October 21 to November 11) – Skate-o-Ween in San Van is a lighthearted Halloween celebration that’s less about the spook and more about getting a chuckle, creating an inventive costume, and just skating in a fun outfit. Keep an eye out for the spooky decor around the city!
    • 7-Play Maple Harvest (November 18 to December 2) – The annual San Van 7-Ply Maple Harvest is a long-standing festival celebrating the city’s unique maple trees; in the 70s, skaters discovered that the trees’ wood were perfectly suited for skateboard construction. It’s a community tradition rooted in accomplishments, growth, and reflection.
  • New Challenges and Tasks – Season 1 will introduce 40 new Challenges that will rotate in and out weekly. Players can also take on all-new daily, weekly, seasonal and event Tasks to earn Tix and unlock fresh rewards.
  • New Brand Partners and Soundtrack Additions – New brands are joining the in-game store, including NHS’s Santa Cruz, Creature and Independent. Season 1 also brings 21 new songs with a 90s vibe—featuring tracks from Bad Religion, Dinosaur Jr., Ice Cube, and more. The full track drops soon!
  • Lightning Update and skate.Pass – Launching alongside Season 1 is the brand new Lighting Update and skate.Pass, which you can read more about in The Grind Vol. 6.

Read more about the update via the skate. Early Access Season 1 blog.

skate. is currently in Early Access for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC via Steam.

Watch a new trailer below. View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

Early Access Season 1 Trailer

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯

item.title: Yooka-Replaylee physical edition launches December 18
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Includes game map poser and character stickers pack.

The physical edition of Yooka-Laylee remake Yooka-Replaylee will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 on December 18, distributor PM Studios and developer Playtonic Games announced.

Priced at $49.99, the physical edition includes a copy of the game (on a physical cartridge for Switch 2), a collectible game map poster, and an exclusive character stickers pack.

The digital edition of Yooka-Replaylee is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and PC via Steam on October 9 for $29.99.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/10/yooka-replaylee-physical-edition-launches-december-18
